definition: abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards

sentences.english: That is getting the whole thing backward, of course.
sentences.chinese: 这当然是将整个事情又朝后推了。

sentences.english: The air flowing backward pushes the balloon forward.
sentences.chinese: 朝后流动的空气将汽球向前推动。

sentences.english: No perpendicular fall is necessary, in front any more than in the rear.
sentences.chinese: 无论朝前和朝后，陡直的下坠总是不必要的。

sentences.english: The thief was brought in with his hands tied back.
sentences.chinese: 那个小偷被带进来，手被朝后绑着。

sentences.english: IK looked back to see if the headless man has stopped.
sentences.chinese: 伊卡博得朝后看了看那个无头人是否停下来了。

sentences.english: First, put his head slowly toward after lift.
sentences.chinese: 第一，把该人的脑袋缓缓朝后仰起。

sentences.english: Tie the door back-it keeps banging to and fro in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 把门朝后绑牢，它在风里不停地来回砰砰作响。

sentences.english: I was ascertaining whether the cellar stretched out in front or behind.
sentences.chinese: 我当时是要弄清楚地下室是朝前还是朝后延伸的。

sentences.english: His electric meter actually runs backward, thus reducing his bill.
sentences.chinese: 他的电表实际上朝后转，这样就减少了电费。

sentences.english: Daniel leaned back on the sofa, still chewing on his apple.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔朝后靠在沙发上，还在嚼着他的苹果。

sentences.english: Don't let head usually toward see behind, it can make you vacant if lose.
sentences.chinese: 不要让头经常朝后看，它能使你茫然若失。

sentences.english: I lost my balance and toppled backward to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 我失去了平衡，朝后栽倒在地板上。

definition: to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
